snippet: Mr. Bush signaled that if he ran for president, his campaign would argue against ideological purity tests and challenge Republican orthodoxy on issues like immigration and education.
abstract: Jeb Bush, speaking to audience at George Bush Presidential Library and Museum, signals that if he runs for president in 2016, his campaign will argue against ideological purity tests and challenge Republican orthodoxy on issues like immigration and education; says he will decide by end of 2014.

byline.contributor: Elena Schneider contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Bush signaled that if he ran for president, his campaign would argue against ideological purity tests and challenge Republican orthodoxy on issues like immigration and education.

headline.main: Jeb Bush Talks Approach If He Runs for President
headline.print_headline: Jeb Bush Talks Approach if He Runs for President
